reviewText:
This game is by no means BAD or anything, but I also can't really recommend it.  The control scheme -- as many other reviewers have mentioned -- is just simply too clunky for the game to be much fun.

What I mean is, mostly, it's hard to really classify this as a platformer (albeit a puzzle platformer, even) because everything is always interrupted a thousand times by clunkily shooting arrows.  As others have mentioned (again), you have to click on the KNIGHT in order to change between shot types as well.

For now I'm going to give this a No".. but I really do think there's something good here as far as the concept and level design.  If the controls were patched SOMEHOW I'd give the game another shot for sure."

reviewText:
Interesting concept, terrible execution.
This falls victim to the same thing that made me not enjoy Portal 2 as much. You're given an ability, but you're incredibly limited by it. Imagine if the Flash could only run on sidewalks, or if Batman could only grapple onto white outcroppings. Sure, the game would be incredibly easy if everything could have an arrow in it, but the amount you're limited saps the game of any fun.

The physics aren't all that great either. Everything feels very loose. Boxes are way lighter than they look, and if you're standing on an arrow you shot at an angle you'll slide down it. The visuals are awful as well. I'd expect this level of quality from a free flash game, but charging a dollar is ridiculous.

Another major issue I have is the way you select arrows. In the level it tells you about it in, it says to click the Tinboy dude. This shows three bubbles, each representing a different arrow. The hitbox for triggering the menu is way off, resulting in you opening the menu for switching arrows when you try to shoot. What makes this worse is that you can also switch arrows by pressing 1, 2, and 3. There's no options menu to change any of this either.

I honestly cannot reccomend this to anyone, not even for the 14 cents its been available for this week.

reviewText:
Cheap game, so I bought it and did a video for it. Check out the video to get a sense of the gameplay or read my quick review below.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5OBXKkQfxB0

Tinboy is a puzzle-platform game in the 8bit style.  Players must make their way through various levels of an AI Testing Arena, starting at one door and navigating various platforms and obstacles to reach an exit.  They are aided in this by the use of a multi-purpose bow which can fire ordinary arrows, rope arrows or exploding arrows. Each arrow type enables the player to affect different game mechanics.

Pros:
+puzzles have a basic structure but could be solved a number of ways
+mechanics are simple but allow for depth of level design
+puzzles appear to be well thought out
+challenging enough to maintain interest
+difficulty scales in a reasonable way

Cons:
-some controls are not intuitive (double jump to release rope, finicky bow aiming method)
-UI is a little unintuitive (surely an ESC menu for quitting isn't too much to ask)
-No options menu (for turning down/off game audio, for example or rebinding keys)
-Graphics get a bit fuzzy when upscaled.
-Doesn't fully support a controller (it would play better with a controller, imho)

It's a pretty fun, little puzzle-platformer and, for the price they're asking, it's worth it. So, I'll give it a thumbs up.

reviewText:
Game has promise as a puzzle game, unfortunatly control system of firing arrows is buggy at best and non functional at worst. It needs a better system for selecting ammo and displaying which type is selected. Also the click and drag never seems to work, I couldn't make it past the second level after barely making it past the third.

I'm running this on Windows, and tried both windowed and full screen options.

I would retry and rereview game if controls are improved.

Update:
I was able to figure out a trick to get the bow to work nearly every time, you have to click really far away from your character. Levels are challenging and fun, but I still would like to have improved controls before I play a lot more.

reviewText:
There is not much to say about this game. This is by far the most boring game I have played in a while. Even though there are some challening levels, some of them are stupidly hard just because the gameplay is absolutely trash. I mean.. sure, game costs just a dollar/euro, even lower when on sale, and it has trading cards, but it simply doesn't make up for the quality of this game. It's not the worst game I have ever played, it's just too basic for a platformer. Uninteresting repetitive level design, almost every level just about the same. Only thing that could save this dull experience would be a great soundtrack. But I think you've already guessed it - it's gruesome. Overall, I don't recommend you to buy this game at full price (even though it's just a dollar/euro) and since it seems like a small project/game, I doubt it will ever get updated with some better controls or/and levels, so don't get your hopes up.

PROS  interesting idea with arrows (also with 3 different types of arrows)
trading cards
CONS  gameplay - controls
boring enviroment
repetitive after few levels
soundtrack
too basic - meaning not interesting in any way

reviewText: It's actually a good game for what it is. If I where to pick one thing out, the controls are a bit unresponsive. People do tend to have trouble with the drawback mechanism, but its only problem is it's a bit unresponsive unless you pull back horizontally, which in most cases you need to shoot on an angle, and the clicking on the character to change weapon types isn't too bad either. One suggestion I would make is to change the overall layout, like making an HUD where you can press 1 to use standard arrows, 3 for explosives, and 2 for grappiling hook. It's a simple game and it is challenging, not because of the controls, but because it's a difficult game, and welcomingly so. Overall, it's a good way to waste time if you really have nothing else to do or if you enjoy a good challenge especially for the price. It costs as much as a crappy iPhone game but it has better quality, and not to mention the 200 FPS gameplay, and I don't even have a good graphics card.

reviewText:
To the developer of this game (if you read this lol):

I really like the concept of this game. It seems fun and it has a lot of potential. I really like the whole platforming puzzle aspect of it. It's a fairly unique concept and I hope you continue to improve it.

That said I would recommend you work on the controls of this game. They are a little clunky and could use some work. I also thing you could add some more sound to it. It's a little quiet. Even some simple beats can go a long way. I'm not hating on you, I know this is probably one of your first tries at a game and I appreciate it.

I know it sounds weird put it kind of feels portal ish. Like trying to find a way to the end of the level by using your bow and arrow instead of the portal gun.

Don't give up! I really like it and I hope to see more of your work :D

reviewText:
If you're looking for a review you've come to the wrong place, if you're here to cook a pie then read on !
Napoleon from the final puff pastry
You will need:
Ready flaky pastry - 1.5 kg five eggs Flour - 150 g> Sugar - 400 grams Milk - 1200 ml Vanilla sugar - 1 n. Cognac - 1 tbsp. l. Shelled walnuts - glass sequence of preparation: dough defrost naturally at room temperature (defrost time indicated on the package). Cook the custard: grind the egg yolks with a mixer or a whisk to a conventional incandescent and vanilla sugar, flour and brandy to enter the mix. The mixture pour a trickle of milk, stir and cook, stirring constantly. Divide the dough into the desired number of pieces that will later Korzh. Roll out each piece on a board sprinkled with flour. Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes until golden color on a dry baking temperature of 200 degrees. Fluff the cooled cream cakes. If desired, each layer sprinkled with chopped nuts. On top of the cake lightly press smeared with cream and sprinkle all sides crumbs. Add layer cake in a cool place overnight.
